props.title: Azure
props.toolTipText:
- Cloud is nothing but renting computing resources on demand
- Resources - Servers, DB, FileStorage, MQ, CDN, etc... (1000+)
- Sharing the responsibility of managing the service btw Azure and You, is called Shared responsibility Model

- Types of cloud platforms
   - Public Cloud - available for general public
   - Private Cloud - available to selected users
   - Hybrid Cloud - combines private and public clouds

- Pricing depends on type of service
   - VMs paid for usage hours
   - Storage Services paid for volume
   - Network services on bandwidth etc...
- with Cloud you have only operational expenditure and avoid capital expenditure

- Benefits of cloud computing
   - High Availability
   - Scalability
   - Elasticity (autoscaling)
   - Reliability (recover from failures)
   - Predictability (able to forecast, and control the behavior)
   - Security
   - Governance (policies that guides cloud operations)
   - Manageability

Service Types
   - IAAS - VM, VN, etc..
   - PAAS - DB
   - SAAS - Office365

props.title: Architecture
props.toolTipText: - Architecture

props.title: Region
props.toolTipText:
- Areas of the world where Azure has sets of data centres (min 3)
- Over 60+ regions around the world
- Region pair has speed connection btw them
- Sovereign region not connected to Azure public cloud
   - approval needed o join Sovereign region
   - separate policies and compliance standards
   - for governments and private orgs.

props.title: Availability Zone
props.toolTipText:
- AZ are physically separate locations within a region

Types of  AZ services
   - Zonal services - deploying to specific AZ
   - Zone redundant services - auto deploying to multiple AZ
   - Non-regional services / always available services

props.title: Management Group
props.toolTipText:
- can contain one or more subscriptions and group them
- can apply policies on them

props.title: Subscription
props.toolTipText:
- billing unit within Azure
- Always a payment method associated with subscription
- User can have multiple subscriptions and roles

Plans
- free 
- pay as you go
- enterprise agreement
- Free credits, startup, student plans

props.title: Resource Group
props.toolTipText:
- logical group of resources
- associate with a region, can be from different region
- some kind of similar lifecycle
- Permission can assigned at resource group level
- no intra permissions between groups
- belong to subscription

props.title: Resource
props.toolTipText:
- Azure service you have access to, actual things
- Can be created using Portal, CLI, PowerShell, etc...
- each resource has a name created by you
- we need to indicate the region, where its need to run
- associated with one resource grup
- associated with one subscription for billing

props.title: New
props.toolTipText:
- all VNets are divided into subnets
- assigned a range of IP addresses with in parent VNet
- there is a security layer between subnets too
- all VM must belong to at least one subnet, using NIC
- som VMs have more than one NIC, so belong to more than one subnet
- VMs can optionally assign to public IP

props.title: New
props.toolTipText:
- Virtual private Network
- allows communication between 2 networks
- encrypts the traffic between 2 points
- outside Azure, you require physical device
- inside Azure, we can use VPN Gateway as virtual device
- VPN gateway requires its own subnet
- Point2Site, Site2Site peering
- Expressroute - high speed connection from your ISP to Azure

props.title: New
props.toolTipText:
- sometime called VNets
- microsoft has extensive physical network across globe
- no 2 VMs talk to each other - security
- virtual networks assigned an address space - IPV4, IPV6 or both 
- there is no shortage of private IP addresses

props.title: New
props.toolTipText:
- also called NSG
- access control list(ACL) that blocks traffic inbound and outbound of a subnet
- 5 tuple match - Source IP/ Port/ Dest IP/ Port/ Protocol
- allow and deny rules
- they have priority in rules

props.title: New
props.toolTipText:
- communication is blocked between subnets in different VNet
- connecting 2 subnets is called peering
- this allows one VM on a subnet to connect to other VM in different subnet in different VNet

props.title: New
props.toolTipText:
- domain name system
- we can assign name to IP using DNS
- applies internal to Azure
   - http://development.local

props.title: Compute
props.toolTipText:
- executing code

Types
- VM
- VM Scale Sets
- App Services
- Azure Container Instance
- Azure Kubernetes Service
- Azure Virtual Desktop

props.title: Azure Functions
props.toolTipText:
- small pieces of code that run on cloud
- typically a utility function - does something specific in a finite amount of time
- is triggered by something happening
- very expensive

props.title: Containers
props.toolTipText:
- another paradigm for running code in cloud
- contains everything the app needs in a container image
- fastest and easiest to deploy
- Azure container Instance (ACI) - single instance
- Azure container Apps - like a web service, advanced features
- Azure Kubernetes Service - runs on cluster of servers

props.title: App Services
props.toolTipText:
- for web apps
- a new paradigm for running code in cloud
- give your code and configuration to Azure, it will run for you
- promise of performance with no access to hardware
- platform as a service

props.title: VM Scale Set
props.toolTipText:
- Group of VMs
- can be scaled based on some rules (elastic)
   - based on demand
   - based on schedule, etc...
- in-front load balancer to distribute traffic
- can be scaled up to 100 VMs
- can be configured up to 100 VMs in a Scale Set

Availability Sets
- multiple VMs with identical function
- signify Azure that they should be separated from each other
- separate fault domain or update domain
- separate source sources and network switches
- updated on at a time, not all together

Proximity Group
- multiple VMs with identical function
- arranged in a VM Scale Set
- you want them placed close together
- less availability for more performance
- fast inter-server communication

props.title: Virtual Desktop
props.toolTipText:
- desktop version of windows that runs on cloud
- your software installed, your files - available from anywhere
- can even see from iOS and Android

props.title: VM
props.toolTipText:
- over 700 types
- varying by RAM, CPU cores, CPU speed, IOPS etc..
